definition: the activity of making money by starting or running businesses, especially when this involves taking financial risks; the ability to do this
examples: the reforms are designed to encourage entrepreneurship and promote business and investment.
his entrepreneurship helped put preston on the map as a thriving cotton manufacturing town.

definition: a person or company that is involved in a particular organization, project, system, etc., especially because they have invested money in it
a person who holds all the bets placed on a game or race and who pays the money to the winner
examples: all our employees are stakeholders in the company.
the government has said it wants to create a stakeholder economy in which all members of society feel that they have an interest in its success.

definition: the rate at which a worker, a company or a country produces goods, and the amount produced, compared with how much time, work and money is needed to produce them
examples: high/improved/increased productivity
wage rates depend on levels of productivity.
the low agricultural productivity of the country

definition: the ability to make a profit
examples: to increase profitability

definition: an act of organizing something such as a system or a company in a new and different way
examples: the company is undergoing a major restructuring.

definition: the process of arranging for somebody outside a company to do work or provide goods for that company
examples: the outsourcing of it work to private contractors

definition: relating to a way of working in which people from different teams across an organization work together
examples: the projects require cross-functional teams to come together and work as a unit.

definition: a plan for running a business, identifying where the money will come from, who the customers are, how they will be reached, etc.
examples: many companies in asia follow this business model.
adopt a new direction by rethinking your business model.
a business model for using electronic commerce

definition: an idea, a design, etc. that somebody has created and that the law prevents other people from copying
examples: intellectual property rights

definition: the work of collecting information about what people buy and why
examples: i work for a market research organization.

definition: a study done by an organization in order to find its strengths and weaknesses, and what problems or opportunities it should deal with. swot is formed from the initial letters of ‘strengths’, ‘weaknesses’, ‘opportunities’ and ‘threats’.
examples: i did a swot-analysis of the company and found that it was lacking in many areas.

definition: the act of dividing existing and potential customers into groups according to their age, gender, class, income, etc.
examples: in order to create a targeted marketing campaign, we need to first segment the market.

definition: the money that a company or person earns from a particular activity; a means by which a company or person earns money
examples: hiring the venue out for weddings will create an additional revenue stream.
the show has become a lucrative revenue stream for the tv company.

definition: the act of comparing one thing to another, often used in business to compare products, services, etc.
examples: the company uses benchmarking to compare their products to the competition.

definition: a business or proposition's offer of value to its potential customers or clients, as opposed to its features or benefits
examples: our value proposition is simple: the best products at the best prices.

definition: the activity of developing new products or services within an organization, typically by working in a team
examples: the company is encouraging intrapreneurship by giving employees time and resources to work on new ideas.

definition: an advantage that a company has over its competitors in the marketplace
examples: the company's competitive advantage is its ability to innovate.
the company has a competitive advantage over its rivals.

definition: the standards of behavior that a business requires of its employees
examples: many companies have policies governing business ethics.

definition: the culture within an organization, including the values, beliefs, and behaviors that contribute to the unique social and psychological environment of the organization.
examples: the organizational culture of the company is very important.
the organizational culture of the company is very important.

definition: the fundamental goals and objectives that drive a company's business
examples: the specific knowledge and skills that give a company a competitive advantage
to table a question in Parliament
We were asked to list our ten favourite songs.
liquid nitrogen
She's always been mean with money.
Give the room a good sweep.
an independent collective making films for television

definition: used at the beginning of a letter before the name or title of the person that you are writing to
examples: Dear Sir or Madam
